name: Take a Breather
desc: Spend an uninterrupted moment to get your breath. Can't repeat
note: If using INT: find a strategic safe spot FAIL: there's something wrong with the spot, if using DEX: avoid attention. FAIL: foe moves to a spot where you're disadvantaged

name: Bravely Run Away
desc: As long as you’re not cornered or surrounded, escape your foes. Lose (4-SPEED) Stamina

name: Good Cardio
desc: Just a momentary pause and you're back in the action. When you would normally lose a Stamina Point from physical exhaustion, you can choose to put an exhaustion token on this card instead
r1: Recover 1d4 Stamina.  Your foe moves to a position of advantage.
r-1: Recover 1 Stamina.  Your foe moves to a position of advantage.
r-2: Your foe moves to a position of advantage

name: And This Is For...
desc: Once per breather, After successfully striking a foe in melee, add a punch, kick, or shove.

name: Where It Hurts
desc: Turn one EX into a BR on your attack

name: Signature Weapon
desc: Weapon does not use a EQUIP point

name: Like A Second Skin
desc: Wear armour for 1 fewer EQUIP points

name: Dwarven Vices
desc: You can take EX from drinking, but never BR

name: Spritely Darting
desc: Flip an extra DEX to Defy Danger when using your small size

name: Enraged
desc: (Only when you've taken BR since your last Breather) When dealing damage in melee, flip INT. Add fatigue for every ✗
note: While Enraged, you are nearly non-verbal.  You cannot make plans with your allies.  Make an INT flip to calm down or wait 60 seconds when combat is over

name: Heirloom
desc: same as DW

name: Tough Stuff
desc: When you would normally take physical harm, you can choose to put a harm token on this card instead.

name: Mystic Breathwork
desc: When you would normally lose a Stamina Point from physical exhaustion, you can choose to put an exhaustion token on this card instead

name: Tool Twisting
desc: Add magic item’s power to a weapon.  The magic item is destroyed.  Write the power on the weapon card.  The weapon only has 1 charge

name: Armour Mastery
desc: add 1 red card on your armour to avoid taking a BR

name: Seeing Red
desc: + 1 to Discern Realities during combat

name: Intimidate
desc: For Parley against a target not significantly bigger than you, flip STR as well as INT.  Take the best

name: Scent of Blood
desc: Use your weapon to deal extra damage. Use this instead of "And This Is For...". In melee, flip DEX to deal fatigue again on the same foe.  Any weapon effects happen as well.  After use, flip this card face-down until you next Take A Breather

name: Goreography
desc: Once per breather, Use instead of Scent of Blood. * hit a second target during your attack * deal a wound * disarm your foe
r-1: Deal 1d4 fatigue to the same  foe

name: Trap Expert
desc: same as DW

name: Pick Pockets
desc: same as DW
r1: The GM will offer you two options between suspicion, danger, or cost

name: Disable Traps
r1: The GM will offer you two options between suspicion, danger, or cost

name: Backstab
desc: same as DW

name: Weak Spot
desc: See a foe from an angle they weren’t expecting and say a weakness you observed, when anyone acts on this info, take +1 forward.

name: Bum Rush
desc: Spend x Stamina to rush an unsuspecting foe, choose to either move past them or deal fatigue. * move past them out of their reach * be at their back * deal fatigue to the foe * perform an UNENCUMBERED move
r-1: Choose 1 and the foe manages to deal 1 fatigue to you

name: Find Shadows
desc: Nighttime or indoors, while no foe is bearing down on you, regain 1d4 Stamina when Taking a Breather, without needing to flip. Foes cannot see you until you move

name: Escape Route
desc: same as DW

name: Vanish
desc: Spend one META and describe how the environment or recent events provided a distraction that let you escape the attention of any foes around you

name: Called Shot
desc: same as DW except Head – choose WD or deal your fatigue

name: Come and get me
desc: Put an environmental hazard between you and a foe and goad them to approach
r2: They succumb to the danger and cannot respond to your next action
r1: They succumb to the danger's effects
r-1: They see your plan and respond
r-2: You succumb to a danger you did not see

name: Not on my turf
desc: While in a pursuit, spend one META and describe one way it is about to change: * we go above * we go below * the air changes * the earth changes * the water changes

name: Sangfroid
desc: When you would lose 1 stamina from mental exhaustion, put 1 EX token on this card instead

name: Use a Magic Item
desc: Lose 1 charge. * lose 1 charge on all your other magic items * lose all remaining charges on this item * lose a charge on this item permanently
r2: The spell / effect is successfully cast
r1: The spell / effect is cast and choose
r-1: The spell / effect is cast, GM chooses
r-2: The spell / effect fails.  The GM will say how

name: Entreat the Blood-Bound
desc: Take a WD. Until the WD is healed, using magical items does not cost the usual 1 charge (though charges may be lost via other effects)

name: Channel Living Light
desc: Use this before using a magical item.  Instead of the item losing a charge, you might lose Stamina from mental exhaustion

name: Sever-Pulse Shield
desc: Before losing Stamina or taking Harm, end any ongoing magical effect of your magic item.  You can cancel losing 1-3 Stamina points, by losing instead 1-3 charges on the item. To cancel taking a Harm, flip the item card over face-down.

name: Void Transfusion
desc: When you Entreat the Blood-Bound, also flip face-up any of your magic items that have been discharged

name: Reach Out With Your Feelings
desc: While you have skin contact with an undepleted magical item, you are attenuated to the universe and have an extra split-second reaction time.  Lose 2 fewer Stamina from physical exhaustion  when attacked

name: Cosmic Shunt
desc: Discard this card until you rest. Change a magic item’s effect to that of another item’s that you’ve seen.  New difficulty is set to the other item’s default.
r1: New effect imbued, but with permanently 1 less charge
r-1: New effect imbued, but with permanently 1 less charge
r-2: An effect of the GM’s choice is imbued instead

name: Fundamental Magic
desc: Cast a spell having the effect of a magic item’s effect you’ve seen before.
r1: Lose 2 Stamina, put this card face-down until you rest
r-1: Lose 3 Stamina, put this card face-down until you rest
r-2: Lose 4 Stamina, put this card face-down until you rest

name: Counterspell
desc: When you attempt to counter a magical effect that will otherwise affect you, stake one magical item on the defense and flip
r2: The spell is countered and has no effect on you
r1: the spell is countered, the item loses a charge
r-1: the spell is countered, the item is depleted
